main event: A drop-shaped silver object was observed for 15-20 minutes in Topeka, Kansas on September 3, 1962.
interesting points: The object was the size of a small silver ball with a tail, round in the front, and had two lights on the back end approximately 30 to 35 degrees apart.
The object fluttered and seemed to be descending, making a swishing sound.
The object was first noted due to a bright reflection from the sun, and was traveling at a very slow rate of speed.
The object remained at about the same elevation until it disappeared, making no maneuvers and having a straight and slow flight path.
The observer was a civilian, a 22-year-old linotype machinist who previously worked for Boeing during the B-29 program.
